# Arpeggio: 9th in C (Shape: E)

An arpeggio is when the notes of a chord are played in succession, rather than simultaneously. In this case, we are considering the 9th arpeggio in the key of C played using an E shape on the guitar. The 9th arpeggio includes the notes C, E, G, B, and D.

## Notes and Intervals:
- C - Root
- E - Major 3rd
- G - Perfect 5th
- B - Major 7th
- D - Major 9th

## Genre and Musical Flavor:
The 9th arpeggio in C with the E shape brings a sophisticated and jazzy flavor to music. It is commonly used in jazz, fusion, and R&B genres where musicians want to add color and complexity to their chord progressions.

## Songs:
1. **"So What" by Miles Davis**: This iconic jazz tune features arpeggios based on 9th chords, creating a cool and laid-back atmosphere.
   
2. **"Isn't She Lovely" by Stevie Wonder**: The guitar intro of this classic song utilizes arpeggios with extended chords, including the 9th, adding rich harmonies to the melody.
   
3. **"Spain" by Chick Corea**: This fusion jazz piece showcases intricate arpeggios, including the 9th arpeggio in C, highlighting the technical and melodic capabilities of the musicians.
